name: Buffalo Chicken Quesadillas
author: Diana71
summary: This is an easy way to serve up a quick dinner with a lot of flavor! No need to use oil or butter to toast each side of the quesadilla, but you can if you'd like. I prefer a dry heat. Tortillas made with a corn-flour mixture work best. Serve with either Buffalo sauce, ranch dressing, or sour cream!
ingredients: 2 ounces cream cheese, softened to room temperature
salt and ground black pepper to taste
½ (1 inch) cube shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese
8 (6 inch) tortillas, or more as needed
directions: Place chicken tenders into a medium-sized pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat
Reduce temperature to medium-low and simmer until chicken tenders are cooked through, 6 to 8 minutes
Transfer to a cutting board and cut or shred as desired
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook shallot until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes
Combine cream cheese, ranch dressing, Buffalo sauce, and cooked shallots in a bowl; mix until creamy
Add cooked chicken and season with salt and pepper
Spread Buffalo chicken mixture onto a tortilla and top with Colby-Monterey Jack cheese and Gouda cheese
Cover with a second tortilla and set quesadilla aside
Repeat with remaining tortillas, chicken mixture, and cheese
Heat a skillet over medium heat
Add 1 quesadilla and cook until browned on 1 side, about 3 minutes
Carefully flip and cook until tortilla is crisp and cheese is melted, about 3 more minutes
